definitions.text: an original creation (i.e., an audio recording) from which copies can be made
something that serves as a model or a basis for making copies
examples: this painting is a copy of the original

definitions.text: preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed
examples: the original inhabitants of the Americas
the book still has its original binding
restored the house to its original condition
the original performance of the opera

definitions.text: (of e.g. information) not secondhand or by way of something intermediary
examples: his work is based on only original, not secondary, sources

definitions.text: being or productive of something fresh and unusual; or being as first made or thought of
not derived or copied or translated from something else
examples: the play is original; not an adaptation
he kept the original copy and gave her only a xerox
the translation misses much of the subtlety of the original French
